verses.verse: Now Jacob <WH3290> lived <WH3427> in the land <WH776> where <WH4033> his father had sojourned, <WH1> in the land <WH4033> of Canaan. <WH776>

These <WH428> are [the records of] the generations <WH8435> of Jacob. <WH3290> Joseph, <WH3130> when seventeen <WH7651> <WH6240> years <WH8141> of age, <WH1121> was pasturing <WH7462> the flock <WH6629> with his brothers <WH251> while he was [still] a youth, <WH5288> along with the sons <WH1121> of Bilhah <WH1090> and the sons <WH1121> of Zilpah, <WH2153> his father's wives. <WH1> And Joseph <WH802> brought <WH3130> back a bad <WH935> <WH1681> report <WH7451> about them to their father.

Now Israel <WH3478> loved <WH157> Joseph <WH3130> more <WH4480> than <WH4480> all <WH3605> his sons, <WH1121> because <WH3588> he was the son <WH1121> of his old <WH2208> age; <WH2208> and he made <WH6213> him a varicolored <WH6446> tunic. <WH3801>

And his brothers <WH251> saw <WH7200> that their father loved <WH1> him more <WH157> than <WH4480> all <WH4480> his brothers; <WH3605> and [so] they hated <WH251> him and could <WH8130> not speak <WH3201> to him on friendly <WH1696> terms. <WH7965>
Then Joseph <WH3130> had <WH2492> a dream, <WH2472> and when he told <WH5046> it to his brothers, <WH251> they hated <WH8130> him even <WH5750> more. <WH3254> <WH5750>
And he said <WH559> to them, "Please <WH4994> listen <WH8085> to this <WH2088> dream <WH2472> which <WH834> I have had; <WH2492>

for behold, <WH2009> we were binding <WH481> sheaves <WH485> in the field, <WH7704> and lo, <WH2009> my sheaf <WH485> rose <WH6965> up and also <WH1571> stood <WH5324> erect; <WH5324> and behold, <WH2009> your sheaves <WH485> gathered <WH5437> around <WH5437> and bowed <WH7812> down <WH7812> to my sheaf. <WH485> "

Then his brothers <WH251> said <WH559> to him, "Are you actually <WH4427> going to reign <WH4427> over <WH5921> us? Or <WH518> are you really <WH4910> going to rule <WH4910> over us?" So they hated <WH8130> him even <WH5750> more <WH3254> <WH5750> for his dreams <WH2472> and for his words. <WH1697>

Now he had <WH2492> still <WH5750> another <WH312> dream, <WH2472> and related <WH5608> it to his brothers, <WH251> and said, <WH559> "Lo, <WH2009> I have had <WH2492> still <WH5750> another dream; <WH2472> and behold, <WH2009> the sun <WH8121> and the moon <WH3394> and eleven <WH259> <WH6240> stars <WH3556> were bowing <WH7812> down <WH7812> to me."

And he related <WH5608> [it] to his father and to his brothers; <WH1> and his father rebuked <WH251> him and said <WH1> to him, "What <WH1605> is this <WH559> dream <WH4100> that you have had <WH2088>? Shall I and your mother <WH2472> and your brothers <WH2492> actually <WH517> come <WH251> to bow <WH935> ourselves down <WH935> before you to the ground <WH7812>?"
And his brothers <WH251> were jealous <WH7065> of him, but his father kept <WH1> the saying <WH8104> [in mind.]
Then his brothers <WH251> went <WH1980> to pasture <WH7462> their father's flock <WH6629> in Shechem. <WH7927>

And Israel <WH3478> said <WH559> to Joseph, <WH3130> "Are not your brothers <WH251> pasturing <WH7462> [the flock] in Shechem <WH7927>? Come, <WH1980> and I will send <WH7971> you to them." And he said <WH559> to him, "I will go. <WH2009>"

Then he said <WH559> to him, "Go <WH1980> now <WH4994> and see <WH7200> about the welfare <WH7965> of your brothers <WH251> and the welfare <WH7965> of the flock; <WH6629> and bring <WH7725> word <WH1697> back <WH7725> to me." So he sent <WH7971> him from the valley <WH6010> of Hebron, <WH2275> and he came <WH935> to Shechem. <WH7927>
And a man <WH376> found <WH4672> him, and behold, <WH2009> he was wandering <WH8582> in the field; <WH7704> and the man <WH376> asked <WH7592> him, "What <WH4100> are you looking <WH1245> for?"
And he said, <WH559> "I am looking <WH1245> for my brothers; <WH251> please <WH4994> tell <WH5046> me where <WH375> they are pasturing <WH7462> [the flock.]"

Then the man <WH376> said, <WH559> "They have moved <WH5265> from here; <WH2088> for I heard <WH8085> [them] say, <WH559> 'Let us go <WH1980> to Dothan. <WH1886>'" So Joseph <WH3130> went <WH1980> after his brothers <WH251> and found <WH4672> them at Dothan. <WH1886>
When they saw <WH7200> him from a distance <WH7350> and before <WH2962> he came <WH7126> close <WH7126> to them, they plotted <WH5230> against <WH854> him to put <WH4191> him to death. <WH4191>
And they said <WH559> to one <WH376> another, <WH251> "Here <WH2009> comes <WH935> this <WH1976> dreamer <WH1167>! <WH2472>

"Now <WH6258> then, come <WH1980> and let us kill <WH2026> him and throw <WH7993> him into one <WH259> of the pits; <WH953> and we will say, <WH559> 'A wild <WH7451> beast <WH9130> devoured <WH398> him.' Then let us see <WH7200> what <WH4100> will become <WH1961> of his dreams! <WH2472>"
But Reuben <WH7205> heard <WH8085> [this] and rescued <WH5337> him out of their hands <WH3027> and said, <WH559> "Let us not take <WH5221> his life. <WH5315>"

Reuben <WH7205> further said <WH559> to them, "Shed <WH8210> no <WH408> blood. <WH1818> Throw <WH7993> him into this <WH2088> pit <WH953> that is in the wilderness, <WH4057> but do not lay <WH7971> hands <WH3027> on him" â€“ that he might rescue <WH5337> him out of their hands, <WH3027> to restore <WH7725> him to his father.

So it came <WH1961> about, when <WH9201> Joseph <WH3130> reached <WH935> his brothers, <WH251> that they stripped <WH6584> Joseph <WH3130> of his tunic, <WH3801> the varicolored <WH6446> tunic <WH3801> that was on him;
and they took <WH3947> him and threw <WH7993> him into the pit. <WH953> Now the pit <WH953> was empty, <WH7386> without <WH369> any water <WH4325> in it.

Then they sat <WH3427> down <WH3427> to eat <WH398> a meal. <WH3899> And as they raised <WH5375> their eyes <WH5869> and looked, <WH7200> behold, <WH2009> a caravan <WH736> of Ishmaelites <WH3459> was coming <WH935> from Gilead, <WH1568> with their camels <WH1581> bearing <WH5375> aromatic <WH5219> gum <WH5219> and balm <WH6875> and myrrh, <WH3910> on their way <WH1980> to bring <WH3381> [them] down <WH3381> to Egypt. <WH4714>
And Judah <WH3063> said <WH559> to his brothers, <WH251> "What <WH4100> profit <WH1215> is it for us to kill <WH2026> our brother <WH251> and cover <WH3680> up his blood <WH1818>?

"Come <WH1980> and let us sell <WH4376> him to the Ishmaelites <WH3459> and not lay <WH1961> our hands <WH3027> on him; for he is our brother, <WH251> our [own] flesh. <WH1320>" And his brothers <WH251> listened <WH8085> [to him.]

Then some <WH376> Midianite <WH4084> traders <WH5503> passed <WH5674> by, so they pulled <WH4900> [him] up and lifted <WH5927> Joseph <WH3130> out of the pit, <WH953> and sold <WH4376> him to the Ishmaelites <WH3459> for twenty <WH6242> [shekels] of silver. <WH3701> Thus they brought <WH935> Joseph <WH3130> into Egypt. <WH4714>
Now Reuben <WH7205> returned <WH7725> to the pit, <WH953> and behold, <WH2009> Joseph <WH3130> was not in the pit; <WH953> so he tore <WH7167> his garments. <WH899>
And he returned <WH7725> to his brothers <WH251> and said, <WH559> "The boy <WH3206> is not [there;] as for me, where <WH575> am I to go <WH935>?"
So they took <WH3947> Joseph's tunic, <WH3801> and slaughtered <WH7819> a male <WH8163> goat, <WH8163> and dipped <WH2881> the tunic <WH3801> in the blood; <WH1818>

and they sent <WH7971> the varicolored <WH6446> tunic <WH3801> and brought <WH935> it to their father and said, <WH1> "We found <WH559> this; <WH4672> please <WH2088> examine <WH4994> [it] to [see] whether it is your son's tunic <WH5234> or <WH3801> not."

Then he examined <WH5234> it and said, <WH559> "It is my son's tunic. <WH3801> A wild <WH7451> beast <WH9130> has devoured <WH398> him; Joseph <WH3130> has surely <WH2963> been torn <WH2963> to pieces! <WH2963>"
So Jacob <WH3290> tore <WH7167> his clothes, <WH8071> and put <WH7760> sackcloth <WH8242> on his loins, <WH4975> and mourned <WH56> for his son <WH1121> many <WH7227> days. <WH3117>

Then all <WH3605> his sons <WH1121> and all <WH3605> his daughters <WH1323> arose <WH6965> to comfort <WH5162> him, but he refused <WH3985> to be comforted. <WH5162> And he said, <WH559> "Surely <WH3588> I will go <WH3381> down <WH3381> to Sheol <WH7585> in mourning <WH57> for my son. <WH1121>" So his father wept <WH1> for him.
Meanwhile, the Midianites <WH4084> sold <WH4376> him in Egypt <WH4714> to Potiphar, <WH6318> Pharaoh's officer, <WH5631> the captain <WH8269> of the bodyguard. <WH2876>
